title: Lorecraft Tutorial
subtitle: The World That Notices

notes: Lorecraft reference module: rich narrative, inventory-driven progression, and stateful revisits.
Conditional choices must remain diegetic; item names only appear when the player already has them.

sections.text:
Moonlight breaks on shattered stone. The ruin’s entrance yawns like a cracked jaw, its archway half-swallowed by ivy and time.

You didn’t come here for glory. You came because the local road has gone quiet—and because something in the dark has started paying attention.

A wind sighs from within, carrying cold air and the faint smell of old metal.
sections.system: Tutorial: Your choices move the story. Consequences can change HP, inventory, and flags.

choices.label: Step into the ruin
Circle the entrance and scout for danger

sections.text:
You cross the threshold.

Dust puffs under your boots. A corridor stretches forward—collapsed in places, but passable. Your candle’s flame steadies in the stale air, illuminating carvings worn smooth by centuries.

Somewhere deeper, water drips… then stops, as if something listened.
sections.system: Your candlelight is steady. The ruin watches what you do with it.

choices.label: Take the corridor straight ahead
Move slowly—watch the floor for traps

sections.text:
You circle the archway. The stone here is newer—repairs made long after the ruin fell. Whoever patched it up didn’t do it to keep people out.

You find scuffed footprints in the dirt. Fresh. Not yours.

A tightness creeps into your chest. You’re being sloppy if you pretend you’re alone.
sections.system: The world leaves evidence. If you look for it, it looks back.

choices.label: Enter the ruin with your guard up
Follow the footprints into a side gap in the stone

sections.text:
The corridor narrows. Your candlelight catches a thin wire—too late.

A stone plate snaps under your weight. A dart hisses from the wall and bites your shoulder.

Pain blooms hot, then cold.
sections.system: HP -3. You’re hurt. If you have a Bandage, check Inventory → Consumables to patch yourself up.

choices.label: Rip the dart free and keep moving
Stop and apply a bandage

sections.text:
You advance with your weight on your back foot, eyes tracking the seams between stones.

A wire gleams faintly—trap. You step over it carefully.

The ruin feels… aware. Like the air itself is waiting to see what you’ll do next.
sections.system: You avoided a penalty. Caution is an outcome, too.

choices.label: Continue deeper
Follow a side door marked with a faded sigil

sections.text:
You slip through a gap where the wall has crumbled. The air smells of damp stone and old rot.

A small cache lies hidden beneath a loose slab—someone’s emergency stash.

Inside: a wrapped packet of herbs (useful), and a battered buckler that still holds its shape.
sections.system: Loot matters. If you take it, you can later use it from Inventory.

choices.label: Take the herbs and buckler
Leave it—move quietly back toward the entrance

sections.text:
You push on. The corridor opens into a fractured hall—pillars broken, mosaics smashed, and a dark pool at the center like spilled ink.

Your candlelight doesn’t reach the far corners.

Then you hear it: a slow scrape of something heavy dragged across stone.
sections.system: If you’re carrying tools, this is where they start to matter.

choices.label: Hide behind a broken pillar
Approach the sound with weapon ready
Back away toward the corridor and reassess

sections.text:
You press cloth and pressure to the wound. Your breath steadies.

The pain dulls to a warning. Not gone—just managed.

You move again, a little wiser about where you place your feet.
sections.system: Bandage used. Healing cannot exceed Max HP. For future healing, open Inventory → Consumables and use what you find.

choices.label: Continue into the hall

sections.text:
The side door groans as you pull it open.

Inside is a narrow chapel—collapsed roof, shattered altar, and a single iron reliquary still intact.

Something about it makes your candle flame lean toward it.
sections.system: The reliquary responds to firelight. If you’re holding a Candle, check your Character → Loadout (Special Item).

choices.label: Raise your candle and examine the reliquary
Leave the chapel before something notices you

sections.text:
You tuck yourself behind a pillar, still as stone.

A shape slides into view: a cave-wight—thin limbs, wet-looking skin, eyes like pale coins.

It sniffs the air. Your pulse thunders in your ears.

choices.label: Hold your breath and wait for it to pass
Strike while it’s searching

sections.text:
You step forward. The wight turns.

It moves faster than it looks like it should—skittering, claws clicking.

Instinct pulls you to your dagger.

This fight is not meant to be fair. It’s meant to teach you consequences.

choices.label: Slash with your Rusty Dagger
Try to shove it back and run

sections.text:
You retreat to the corridor mouth. The hall stays quiet for a heartbeat…

Then something breathes—wet and patient—just beyond the candle’s reach.

You can feel the ruin paying attention now. Like it’s weighing you.

choices.label: Return to the hall and face whatever is there
Take the side door you ignored earlier

sections.text:
You lift the candle. The flame brightens—unnaturally steady.

The reliquary’s latch clicks on its own.

Inside rests a small charm etched with looping runes: a Warden Sigil.

It’s not powerful. It’s a promise. Something that says: you were here, and the ruin knows it.
sections.system: Special interaction: CandleMoment flag set.

choices.label: Take the Warden Sigil
Close the reliquary and back away

sections.text:
The wight’s head tilts. For a terrifying moment, you’re sure it can hear you.

Then it crawls away toward the dark pool.

You exhale slowly.

A clever survivor doesn’t win fights. They avoid them.

choices.label: Slip toward the chapel door
Follow the wight at a distance

sections.text:
Steel bites.

Your dagger catches the wight across the ribs. It shrieks—an awful, thin sound.

But it rakes your arm as it recoils. Pain lances bright.

You can win this, but it will cost you.
sections.system: HP -4. This is survivable, but dangerous.

choices.label: Press the attack
Fall back and use the environment

sections.text:
You shove the creature, but it clings like a burr. It drags claws along your side as you bolt.

Your breath tears in your chest.

You don’t have far before you’ll be cornered.
sections.system: HP -2.

choices.label: Sprint toward the chapel door
Run for the exit and abandon the ruin

sections.text:
The sigil warms in your palm. Not heat—recognition.

A whisper slides through the ruin like a page turning:

You are seen.

You return to the hall with a steadier spine.
sections.system: You gained a valuable Special Item.

choices.label: Return to the shattered hall
Equip the Warden Sigil and feel it settle into place

sections.text:
You shadow the wight to the dark pool. The water isn’t water.

It’s a mirror of the ceiling that isn’t there.

The creature leans over it, trembling.

Something stirs beneath the surface—something that feels older than stone.

choices.label: Throw a pebble into the pool
Back away quietly and take the chapel route

sections.text:
You strike again, and again.

The wight collapses in a twitching heap.

Silence follows—heavy, judgmental.

You wipe your blade on a torn banner and notice something gleaming in the creature’s nest: a small vial stoppered in wax.

choices.label: Take the vial
Don’t linger—leave before something bigger arrives

sections.text:
You kick loose rubble into the wight’s path.

It trips, snarling.

You use the moment to retreat, putting stone between you and teeth.

It doesn’t pursue.

Not because it can’t.

Because something else wants you deeper.

choices.label: Take the chapel route
Follow the hall’s far passage into darkness

sections.text:
You focus on the sigil’s weight—how it seems to anchor you.

Your candle flame steadies. The ruin feels less hostile.

Not friendly.

Just… interested.
sections.system: If you equip items via the UI, they affect what appears in your loadout.

choices.label: Proceed to the hall’s far passage

sections.text:
The pebble hits the surface.

The pool doesn’t ripple.

It opens.

A hand—too long, too pale—reaches up and grips the edge.

This is your warning: some choices carry consequences you cannot outfight.
sections.system: WARNING: A lethal path is possible from here if you push your luck.

choices.label: Run. Now.
Lean closer and look into the pool

sections.text:
The vial’s contents glow faintly—like captured dawn.

It feels valuable. Useful.

But you feel a prickle at the back of your neck.

Something noticed the fight.
sections.system: Tip: Use consumables from Inventory. Healing cannot exceed Max HP.

choices.label: Pocket the vial and move on

sections.text:
You find a stairwell spiraling down.

The air grows colder with each step. Your candle throws long shadows that don’t always match your movement.

At the bottom: a sealed door of black stone, carved with the same looping runes as the sigil.

There is no handle.

Only a shallow indentation—like it expects a token.

The ruin is asking a question.
sections.system: Whisper: Some doors answer to what you carry. Check Character → Loadout (Special Items) before you force anything.

choices.label: Press the Warden Sigil to the indentation
Hold your candle to the runes and wait
Force the door open with brute strength

sections.text:
You lean closer.

The pool is not a pool.

It’s a mouth.

Cold wraps your face. Fingers hook behind your jaw.

For one heartbeat, you understand: curiosity is not wisdom. Sometimes it’s just hunger wearing a better mask.
sections.system: This is the lethal consequence path.

choices.label: Try to wrench free
Give in to the pull

sections.text:
You drive your shoulder into the stone.

It doesn’t budge.

Again.

The impact rattles your bones. Your vision flashes white.

When the door finally shifts, it’s not because you won.

It’s because something on the other side let you.

A breath—ancient and pleased—slides across your face.
sections.system: HP -6. If you are low, this can end the run.

choices.label: Step through anyway
Stagger back and flee while you still can

sections.text:
You tear away, skin burning with cold.

Your candle sputters—then steadies.

The pool’s surface becomes still again.

But you’ve been marked by whatever lives beneath.

You don’t know what that means yet.

You only know it noticed you back.

choices.label: Retreat to the stairwell and reassess
Leave the ruin before it can try again

sections.text:
The Warden Sigil fits the indentation like it was made for your hand.

The black stone door sighs open.

Inside is not treasure.

It’s a chamber lined with names—hundreds of them—carved into the walls.

You add yours with a trembling fingertip.

The ruin accepts you.

For now.

You exit the dungeon alive, carrying proof that the world responds to those who dare to touch it.
sections.system: GOOD ENDING: You completed the run and earned a meaningful story victory.

choices.label: Return To Main Menu

sections.text:
You leave the ruin with your heart hammering and your hands shaking.

The night air feels too loud. Too exposed.

You didn’t solve the road’s silence.

You didn’t learn what waits beneath the stone.

But you lived.

Sometimes that’s the only victory you can afford.

And sometimes… survival is just postponing the question.
sections.system: BAD ENDING: You escaped, but you didn’t uncover the ruin’s secret.

choices.label: Return To Main Menu

sections.text:
You lift the candle to the runes.

The flame elongates—thin and vertical—like a blade of light.

For a moment, the black stone becomes translucent.

You see the ruin’s memory: builders laying the first stone, wardens swearing oaths, a door sealed in fear and hope.

Then the vision fades.

The door remains shut.

But something inside has seen you—and decided you’re not a stranger anymore.

You step away with knowledge instead of loot.

In Lorecraft, that can be worth more than gold.
sections.system: SPECIAL ENDING: You earned a lore revelation. The world noticed you noticing it.

choices.label: Return To Main Menu

sections.text:
Your strength gives out.

The ruin doesn’t rage. It doesn’t gloat.

It simply waits, the way stone waits.

This is the tutorial’s rule: when your resource hits zero, the run ends.

Try again. Learn the danger. Use your items when it matters.

The world that notices is not cruel.

It’s just real.
sections.system: DEATH: First failure is expected. You’re learning VerseCraft’s rules through play.

choices.label: Return To Main Menu

blurb: A first run into a ruin that watches you back. Learn VerseCraft’s rules through choices, consequences, and loot—survive long enough to discover what the world remembers.
